message.content: setup CD so when we are merging main, that the docs app is being deployed

content.thinking: The user wants to set up Continuous Deployment (CD) so that when code is merged to main, the docs app gets deployed. Let me first explore the project structure to understand what we're working with.

content.text: Let me explore the project structure to understand the docs app and any existing CI/CD setup.

input.description: Explore docs app and CI/CD setup
input.prompt:
Explore this project thoroughly to understand:
1. The overall project structure (monorepo? what tool - turbo, nx, etc?)
2. Where the docs app lives and what framework it uses (Next.js, Docusaurus, Astro, etc.)
3. Any existing CI/CD configuration (GitHub Actions workflows in .github/workflows/)
4. How the docs app is built and deployed (check package.json scripts, any deployment config)
5. Any existing deployment platform config (Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare Pages, etc.)
6. The docs app's package.json for build commands and dependencies

Be thorough - check .github/workflows/, apps/docs/, packages/, turbo.json, and any deployment-related config files.

1→name: CI
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  pull_request:
     5→  push:
     6→    branches:
     7→      - main
     8→
     9→jobs:
    10→  verify:
    11→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    12→    steps:
    13→      - name: Checkout
    14→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    15→
    16→      - name: Setup Bun
    17→        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
    18→        with:
    19→          bun-version: 1.3.5
    20→
    21→      - name: Install dependencies
    22→        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile
    23→
    24→      - name: Verify lockfile unchanged
    25→        run: git diff --exit-code bun.lock
    26→
    27→      - name: Lint
    28→        run: bun run lint
    29→
    30→      - name: Typecheck
    31→        run: bun run typecheck
    32→
    33→      - name: Test
    34→        env:
    35→          CLICKHOUSE_HOST: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_HOST }}
    36→          CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD }}
    37→        run: bun run test
    38→
    39→      - name: Build
    40→        run: bun run build
    41→

content.content:
1→# CHX Public Docs
     2→
     3→This folder contains the public documentation website for CHX, powered by Astro + Starlight.
     4→
     5→Public docs content lives in `src/content/docs/`.
     6→
     7→Internal planning/spec documents are intentionally kept in the repository-level `/docs` folder and are not part of this site by default.
     8→
     9→## Commands
    10→
    11→- `bun run docs:dev` (from repo root): start local docs server at `localhost:4321`
    12→- `bun run docs:build` (from repo root): build production docs site
    13→

content.content:
jobs:
  verify:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
        with:
          bun-version: 1.3.5

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Verify lockfile unchanged
        run: git diff --exit-code bun.lock

      - name: Lint
        run: bun run lint

content.content:
1→# chkit
     2→
     3→`chkit` is a ClickHouse schema and migration CLI for TypeScript projects.
     4→
     5→## Install & Run
     6→
     7→```bash
     8→bun install
     9→bun run build
    10→bun run chkit --help
    11→```
    12→
    13→## Quick Start
    14→
    15→```bash
    16→bun run chkit init
    17→bun run chkit generate --name init
    18→bun run chkit migrate
    19→bun run chkit migrate --apply
    20→bun run chkit status
    21→bun run chkit check
    22→```
    23→
    24→## Documentation
    25→
    26→- Public docs site (Astro + Starlight): `apps/docs`
    27→- Run locally: `bun run docs:dev`
    28→- Build: `bun run docs:build`
    29→- Internal planning docs: `planning/`
    30→
    31→## Commands
    32→
    33→- `chkit init`
    34→- `chkit generate [--name <migration-name>] [--migration-id <id>] [--config <path>] [--dryrun] [--json]`
    35→- `chkit pull [--out-file <path>] [--database <db>] [--dryrun] [--force] [--config <path>] [--json]`
    36→- `chkit typegen [--check] [--out-file <path>] [--emit-zod] [--no-emit-zod] [--bigint-mode <string|bigint>] [--include-views] [--config <path>] [--json]`
    37→- `chkit migrate [--config <path>] [--apply|--execute] [--allow-destructive] [--json]`
    38→- `chkit status [--config <path>] [--json]`
    39→- `chkit drift [--config <path>] [--json]`
    40→- `chkit check [--config <path>] [--strict] [--json]`
    41→- `chkit plugin [<plugin-name> [<command> ...]] [--config <path>] [--json]`
    42→- `chkit version`
    43→
    44→## Global Flags
    45→
    46→- `--config <path>`: config file path (default: `clickhouse.config.ts`)
    47→- `--json`: machine-readable command output
    48→
    49→## What Each Command Does
    50→
    51→### `chkit init`
    52→
    53→Creates starter files if missing:
    54→
    55→- `clickhouse.config.ts`
    56→- `src/db/schema/example.ts`
    57→
    58→### `chkit generate`
    59→
    60→- Loads schema files from `config.schema`
    61→- Validates definitions
    62→- Diffs against `meta/snapshot.json`
    63→- Writes migration SQL + updates snapshot (unless `--dryrun`)
    64→- Runs `typegen` plugin automatically when configured with `runOnGenerate: true` (default)
    65→
    66→### `chkit typegen`
    67→
    68→- Optional manual command to generate TypeScript types from schema definitions
    69→- `--check` verifies generated output is up-to-date (no write)
    70→- Supports optional Zod emission (`--emit-zod`)
    71→- Returns non-zero on stale/missing artifacts in check mode
    72→
    73→### `chkit plugin pull schema`
    74→
    75→- Pulls live ClickHouse table metadata and writes a local chkit schema file
    76→- Supports `--out-file`, repeated `--database`, `--dryrun`, and `--force`
    77→- Shortcut: `chkit pull ...` (equivalent to `chkit plugin pull schema ...`)
    78→
    79→### `chkit migrate`
    80→
    81→- Always prints pending migration plan first
    82→- Prompts for confirmation when run without `--apply` or `--execute`
    83→- Applies pending migrations immediately when run with `--apply` (or alias `--execute`)
    84→- Maintains `meta/journal.json`
    85→- Blocks execution when:
    86→  - applied-file checksums mismatch
    87→  - pending migration includes destructive operations and `--allow-destructive` is not set in non-interactive mode (interactive mode prompts for explicit confirmation)
    88→
    89→### `chkit status`
    90→
    91→Shows migration counts and checksum mismatch status.
    92→
    93→### `chkit drift`
    94→
    95→Compares live ClickHouse objects to snapshot expectations and reports drift details.
    96→
    97→Drift reason codes you may see:
    98→
    99→- object-level: `missing_object`, `extra_object`, `kind_mismatch`
   100→- table-level: `missing_column`, `extra_column`, `changed_column`, `setting_mismatch`, `index_mismatch`, `ttl_mismatch`, `engine_mismatch`, `primary_key_mismatch`, `order_by_mismatch`, `unique_key_mismatch`, `partition_by_mismatch`, `projection_mismatch`
   101→
   102→### `chkit check`
   103→
   104→CI gate command. Evaluates:
   105→
   106→- pending migrations
   107→- checksum mismatches
   108→- schema drift
   109→- plugin checks (including `typegen` when configured)
   110→
   111→Returns non-zero when enabled checks fail.
   112→
   113→## Config (`clickhouse.config.ts`)
   114→
   115→```ts
   116→import { defineConfig } from '@chkit/core'
   117→import { pull } from '@chkit/plugin-pull'
   118→import { typegen } from '@chkit/plugin-typegen'
   119→
   120→export default defineConfig({
   121→  schema: './src/db/schema/**/*.ts',
   122→  outDir: './chkit',
   123→  migrationsDir: './chkit/migrations',
   124→  metaDir: './chkit/meta',
   125→  plugins: [
   126→    pull({
   127→      outFile: './src/db/schema/pulled.ts',
   128→    }),
   129→
   130→    // Typed registration (recommended):
   131→    typegen({
   132→      outFile: './src/generated/chkit-types.ts',
   133→      emitZod: false,
   134→    }),
   135→
   136→    // Legacy path-based registration (still supported):
   137→    // './plugins/my-plugin.ts',
   138→    // { resolve: './plugins/my-plugin.ts', options: { dryRun: true }, enabled: true },
   139→  ],
   140→
   141→  clickhouse: {
   142→    url: process.env.CLICKHOUSE_URL ?? 'http://localhost:8123',
   143→    username: process.env.CLICKHOUSE_USER ?? 'default',
   144→    password: process.env.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD ?? '',
   145→    database: process.env.CLICKHOUSE_DB ?? 'default',
   146→  },
   147→
   148→  check: {
   149→    failOnPending: true,
   150→    failOnChecksumMismatch: true,
   151→    failOnDrift: true,
   152→  },
   153→
   154→  safety: {
   155→    allowDestructive: false,
   156→  },
   157→})
   158→```
   159→
   160→### Plugin API v1
   161→
   162→Plugin modules should export `definePlugin(...)` from `@chkit/cli`.
   163→
   164→For typed config registration, plugin packages can export helpers that return inline registrations (for example `typegen(...)` from `@chkit/plugin-typegen`).
   165→
   166→- `manifest.apiVersion` must be `1`.
   167→- Optional compatibility gates:
   168→  - `manifest.compatibility.cli.minMajor`
   169→  - `manifest.compatibility.cli.maxMajor`
   170→- Lifecycle hooks:
   171→  - `onConfigLoaded`
   172→  - `onSchemaLoaded`
   173→  - `onPlanCreated`
   174→  - `onBeforeApply`
   175→  - `onAfterApply`
   176→  - `onCheck`
   177→  - `onCheckReport`
   178→- Plugin command namespace:
   179→  - `chkit plugin`
   180→  - `chkit plugin <plugin-name>`
   181→  - `chkit plugin <plugin-name> <command> [args...]`
   182→
   183→## Output Artifacts
   184→
   185→Under `metaDir`:
   186→
   187→- `snapshot.json`: canonical schema snapshot
   188→- `journal.json`: applied migration journal
   189→
   190→Under `migrationsDir`:
   191→
   192→- `YYYYMMDDHHMMSS_<name>.sql`
   193→
   194→## JSON Output Contract
   195→
   196→- Contract document: `planning/07-json-output-contract.md`
   197→
   198→## Contributor Docs
   199→
   200→- Internal architecture and repository structure: `planning/08-internal-structure.md`
   201→- Planning docs index: `planning/README.md`
   202→

content.content:
name: CI

on:
  pull_request:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  verify:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
        with:
          bun-version: 1.3.5

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Verify lockfile unchanged
        run: git diff --exit-code bun.lock

      - name: Lint
        run: bun run lint

      - name: Typecheck
        run: bun run typecheck

      - name: Test
        env:
          CLICKHOUSE_HOST: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_HOST }}
          CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD }}
        run: bun run test

      - name: Build
        run: bun run build

name: CI

on:
  pull_request:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  verify:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
        with:
          bun-version: 1.3.5

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Verify lockfile unchanged
        run: git diff --exit-code bun.lock

      - name: Lint
        run: bun run lint

      - name: Typecheck
        run: bun run typecheck

      - name: Test
        env:
          CLICKHOUSE_HOST: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_HOST }}
          CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD }}
        run: bun run test

      - name: Build
        run: bun run build

name: CI

on:
  pull_request:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  verify:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
        with:
          bun-version: 1.3.5

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Verify lockfile unchanged
        run: git diff --exit-code bun.lock

      - name: Lint
        run: bun run lint

      - name: Typecheck
        run: bun run typecheck

      - name: Test
        env:
          CLICKHOUSE_HOST: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_HOST }}
          CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD }}
        run: bun run test

      - name: Build
        run: bun run build

  deploy-docs:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: verify
    if: github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    permissions:
      contents: read
      deployments: write
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
        with:
          bun-version: 1.3.5

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Build docs
        run: bun run --filter=docs build

      - name: Deploy to Cloudflare Pages
        uses: cloudflare/wrangler-action@v3
        with:
          apiToken: ${{ secrets.CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN }}
          accountId: ${{ secrets.CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID }}
          command: pages deploy dist --project-name=chkit-docs
          workingDirectory: apps/docs

content.text:
Looks good. Here's what was added:

**`deploy-docs` job** that:
- Runs only on pushes to `main` (i.e., merged PRs), not on PR checks
- Waits for the `verify` job to pass first (`needs: verify`)
- Builds just the docs app with `bun run --filter=docs build`
- Deploys the `dist/` output to Cloudflare Pages using `cloudflare/wrangler-action@v3`

**Required GitHub secrets** — you'll need to add these to your repo settings (`Settings > Secrets and variables > Actions`):

| Secret | Description |
|---|---|
| `CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN` | Cloudflare API token with "Cloudflare Pages: Edit" permission |
| `CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID` | Your Cloudflare account ID (found in the dashboard URL or overview page) |

To create the API token, go to [Cloudflare Dashboard > My Profile > API Tokens](https://dash.cloudflare.com/profile/api-tokens) and create a token with the **"Cloudflare Pages: Edit"** permission scoped to your account.

name: CI

on:
  pull_request:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  verify:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
        with:
          bun-version: 1.3.5

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Verify lockfile unchanged
        run: git diff --exit-code bun.lock

      - name: Lint
        run: bun run lint

      - name: Typecheck
        run: bun run typecheck

      - name: Test
        env:
          CLICKHOUSE_HOST: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_HOST }}
          CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD }}
        run: bun run test

      - name: Build
        run: bun run build

  deploy-docs:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: verify
    if: github.event_name == 'push' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    permissions:
      contents: read
      deployments: write
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v2
        with:
          bun-version: 1.3.5

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Build docs
        run: bun run --filter=docs build

      - name: Deploy to Cloudflare Pages
        uses: cloudflare/wrangler-action@v3
        with:
          apiToken: ${{ secrets.CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN }}
          accountId: ${{ secrets.CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID }}
          command: pages deploy dist --project-name=chkit-docs
          workingDirectory: apps/docs

content.text: Done. The `deploy` job now runs `bun run deploy` which triggers `turbo deploy`. Since Turbo's `deploy` task depends on `build` (per `turbo.json`), it'll build everything first, then run the `deploy` script in every package/app that has one. When you add more apps with a `deploy` script, they'll automatically get picked up on merge to main.
